definition: home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: What are you being such a weenie for?So he has a Barbie. Big deal.
sentences.chinese: 你干嘛这么小家子气他有个芭比，有什么大不了？

sentences.english: You look petty and people have stopped listening long ago.
sentences.chinese: 那样你会看上去很小家子气，而听众也早就不想听了。

sentences.english: Fortunately, when pregnant chan is very large, also do not show a petty.
sentences.chinese: 幸好时怀婵十分大量，也没有表现出小家子气的所为。

sentences.english: I know that political campaigns can sometimes seem small, even silly.
sentences.chinese: 我知道政治角力有时会显得小家子气甚至愚蠢。

sentences.english: The ungenerous child would not let anyone else play with her toys.
sentences.chinese: 这个孩子很小家子气，她不让任何人玩她的玩具。

definition: lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
to fail to see the larger issue (idiom)/to fail to grasp the big picture
unkind/harsh/cutting/mean/acrimony/to embezzle by making illegal deductions
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to haggle over every ounce/(fig.) to fuss over minor matters/to split hairs
